org.graphstream.graph.implementations
Class DefaultNode

java.lang.Object
  org.graphstream.graph.implementations.AbstractElement
      org.graphstream.graph.implementations.DefaultNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<Edge>, Element, Node
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiNode, SingleNode
public abstract class DefaultNode
extends AbstractElement
implements Node

Base implementation of a Node for the DefaultGraph.

This node ensures the consistency of the graph. Such a node is able to give informations about all leaving edges but also entering edges (when directed), at the price however of a larger memory footprint.

This is a base implementation that is refined in two classes SingleNode and MultiNode. The first allows only one edge between two nodes, the other allows multiple edges between two nodes (or several loops).

Since:
20020709

getEdgeIterator

public java.util.Iterator<Edge> getEdgeIterator()
Description copied from interface: Node
Iterator on the set of connected edges. This iterator iterates on all edges leaving and entering (this includes any non-directed edge present, and a non-directed edge is only iterated once).

Specified by:
getEdgeIterator in interface Node
Returns:
The iterator, edges are iterated in arbitrary order.

getNeighborNodeIterator

public java.util.Iterator<Node> getNeighborNodeIterator()
Description copied from interface: Node
Iterator on the set of neighbour nodes connected to this node via one or more edges. This iterator iterate across any leaving, entering and non directed edge (nodes are neighbour even if they only have a directed edge from them toward this node).

Specified by:

The iterator, neighbour are iterated in arbitrary order.

getBreadthFirstIterator

public java.util.Iterator<Node> getBreadthFirstIterator()
Description copied from interface: Node
Iterator for breadth first exploration of the graph, starting at this node. If the graph is not connected, only a part of it will be explored. By default, this iterator will respect edge orientation.

Specified by:
getBreadthFirstIterator in interface Node
Returns:
An iterator able to explore the graph in a breadth first way starting at this node.
Complexity:
Same as the breath first iterator: O(n+m) with n the number of nodes and m the number of edges.

Iterator for breadth first exploration of the graph, starting at this node. If the graph is not connected, only a part of it will be explored.

Specified by:
getBreadthFirstIterator in interface Node
Parameters:
directed - If false, the iterator will ignore edge orientation (the default is "True").
Returns:
An iterator able to explore the graph in a breadth first way starting at this node.
Complexity:
Same as the breath first iterator: O(n+m) with n the number of nodes and m the number of edges.
